newsitem.title: USA: Centennial linked to Mass. businessman - newspaper.
newsitem.headline: Centennial linked to Mass. businessman - newspaper.

text.p: Federal investigators are examining links between Centennial Technologies Inc and a wealthy Massachusetts businessman under investigation for alleged tax evasion, the Boston Globe reported Wednesday.

Federal prosecutors are interested in the connections between Robert Lockwood, reportedly the subject of a grand jury investigation, and Emmanual Pinez, fired last month as chief executive of Centennial, the newspaper said.

According to the March 12 grand jury indictment, Pinez allegedly booked phony sales, including at least $2 million worth to BBC Computers of Merrimack, N.H., which is controlled by Lockwood, to make the company's results look better, the Globe reported.

John Falvey, the federal prosecutor handling the Centennial case, told the Globe that the investigation is continuing and "down the road, more will become clear," about the relationship between Lockwood and Pinez. He declined to comment further.
Pinez has been held without bail since his arrest last month. He has denied through his lawyer any wrongdoing.
